#### Declarations diff

`+ addLECancellable_iff_ne_top`

`+ natCast_ne_coe_top`

<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>
This feels too specialized and the proof a bit too inelegant to me.

I'll wait for https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/15380 due to https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/Topology.20of.20.60ENat.60/near/455447883 or simply drop this and use the lemmas there.
We have a similar lemma for `ENNReal`. What's the general fact here? I think that one inequality is true in any complete lattice with monotone `+`. What about the other one?
Maybe monotone `-`? Just guessing :-)
With https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/15380 in the present PR isn't really needed, closing.
After further discussion with Joachim over at #16555, this PR actually is needed. Let me reopen it and revive it.
@YaelDillies has effectively taken over this PR, not sure if theyâ€™ll get pinged on reviews, so Iâ€™ll mention them here.

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#17939~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ðŸ¤–). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->

This currently fails with
```
error: ././././Mathlib/Data/ENat/Basic.lean:268:60: unknown constant 'WithTop.sub_eq_top'
error: ././././Mathlib/Data/ENat/Basic.lean:269:52: unknown constant 'WithTop.sub_ne_top'
```

Ah, I can fix that myself.

Looks good. I'm wondering if some more results (such as `add_iSup`) can be generalized beyond `ENat`, but I don't know precisely the appropriate type classes. But maybe `LinearOrderedAddCommMonoid` (or weaker) + `ConditionallyCompleteLattice` + `OrderedSub` + maybe some `AddLECancellable` conditions.
If so, we could unify `ENNReal` and `ENat` proofs. We can also leave this as a todo.

Looks good. I'm wondering if some more results (such as `add_iSup`) can be generalized beyond `ENat`, but I don't know precisely the appropriate type classes. But maybe `LinearOrderedAddCommMonoid` (or weaker) + `ConditionallyCompleteLattice` + `OrderedSub` + maybe some `AddLECancellable` conditions.
If so, we could unify `ENNReal` and `ENat` proofs. We can also leave this as a todo.

```suggestion
lemma iSup_add (Î¹ : Type*) [Nonempty Î¹] (f : Î¹ â†’ â„•âˆž) (n : â„•âˆž) :
```

This will allow us to write `.of_ne_top h` if the expected type is known.
```suggestion
lemma AddLECancellable.of_ne_top [Preorder Î±] [ContravariantClass Î± Î± (Â· + Â·) (Â· â‰¤ Â·)]
```
This doesn't work because it's in the `WithTop` namespace
If you rename a lemma, then you should add a deprecated alias.
Do you add a variable but don't use it?
What's wrong with the old naming?
I wasn't so sure of that change. Reverted
You can use `exists_gt` to avoid importing `Archimedean`. OTOH, you can prove it for `[Archimedean R] {a : WithTop R} (ha : a â‰  âŠ¤)`.
I think that it's better to create a file `ENat.BigOperators` instead of adding heavy imports to this one.
Actually, the heavy imports can easily be avoided. See #17939
The imports are now only increasing by 22 files. Do you still think it's worth creating a separate one?
I'm confused about this statement. `ENat` is a well-order, so `â¨… i, f i = 0 â†’ âˆƒ i, f i = 0` is unconditionally true, right?

```suggestion
lemma sum_iSup {Î± Î¹ : Type*} {s : Finset Î±} {f : Î± â†’ Î¹ â†’ â„•âˆž}
```
Unless you think that is ambiguous. `finsetSum` occurs only very little in Mathlib, and usually we just write `sum`. Also below.

pullRequest.title: feat(ENat): iSup_add
